oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report of expenses incurred on account of cemeteries and exhuming and reinterring the remains of Federal soldiers

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; National cemeteries; Burials; Chattanooga (Tenn.); War dead, Repatriation of
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report of expenses incurred on account of cemeteries and exhuming and reinterring the remains of deceased Federal soldiers by Brevet Major W. A. Wainwright, Captain Assistant Quartermaster. Includes total of $50,169.95 with $14,654.33 still unpaid. Costs include purchase of land, cost of clerks, laborers, coffins, fencing, lumber, and transportation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. In 1862, the Quartermaster's Department also assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries.
